title: section 75(5)(a) (inserted by section 109 of the Finance Act 2007 (No. 11 of
heading: (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Stamp Duty (Designation of
text_raw:
1. 

(1) These Regulations may be cited as the Stamp Duty (Designation of 

Exchanges and Markets) (No.1) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 20 March 2020.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited stamp duty (designation exchange markets) (no.1) regulation 2020 (2) regulation come operation 20 march 2020

title: section 75(5)(a) (inserted by section 109 of the Finance Act 2007 (No. 11 of
heading: 2. For the purposes of section 75 (inserted by section 109 of the Finance
text_raw:
2. For the purposes of section 75 (inserted by section 109 of the Finance 
Act 2007 (No. 11 of 2007)) of the Stamp Duties Consolidation Act 1999 (No. 
31 of 1999), Euronext Brussels is designated as a market by the Revenue 
Commissioners. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 19 March 2020 

NIALL CODY, 
 Revenue Commissioner. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 

“Iris Oifigiúil” of 24th March, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 EXPLANATORY NOTE 

[87] 3 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

The purpose of these Regulations is the designation by the Revenue 
Commissioners, as on and from 20 March 2020, of Euronext Brussels as a 
market for the purposes of section 75 of the Stamp Duties Consolidation Act

title: section 75(5)(a) (inserted by section 109 of the Finance Act 2007 (No. 11 of
heading: 1999. Section 75 provides for an exemption from stamp duty on a transfer of
text_raw:
1999. Section 75 provides for an exemption from stamp duty on a transfer of 
title to securities to an intermediary where, inter alia, 

⎯ the intermediary is a member of an exchange or market designated 

by the Revenue Commissioners, and 

⎯ the transfer of the securities is effected on the designated exchange 
or market concerned, on the Irish Stock Exchange Limited, the 
London Stock Exchange plc or any other exchange or market 
designated by the Revenue Commissioners.
